page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY-PLACE NAMES
page.content: Cornish is a Celtic language, very similar to Welsh. It was once spoken over all Cornwall and many place names are still in the Cornish language, especially in this area. "Loe" as in Loe pool,means sea lake or estuary."Nans"means valley,so Nansloe means "valley of the sea lake".Nanspean is "little valley". Porth is a Cornish word meaning "cove". Porthleven means "cove of St Elvan". "Pen"is a word meaning head,end or hill.Penventon means "head of the spring".Penrose means "end of the heath".Culdrose possibly means "nook in the heath". Degibna means "from the chapel of St Degiman."Bos" usually means a dwelling place- Boscawen-dwelling of Gawen.It is often difficult to work out place names because they are so ancient.
